intro: Aster altaicus var. tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed aster, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, erect stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers in the late summer and early autumn. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
